discussion.content: The Java EE7 Tutorial 37.1, says: If an entity instance is passed by value as a detached object, such as through a session bean's remote business interface, the class must implement the Serializable interface.

choices.C: always, because JPA entities are required to implement the Serializable interface
choices.D: when JPA entities are used as parameters or return values by the remote EJB operations
choices.B: when JPA entities are used outside of the EJB Lite container
choices.A: when JPA entities are used in the EJB Full container

questions.question_text: When should a JPA entity implement the Serializable interface?

discussion.content: A is correct as per some other sites

questions.question_text: Which statement is true about JAX-RS resource implementation?

choices.A: The REST resource implementation class must extend the javax.ws.rs.core.Application class
choices.C: The REST resource class can be implemented as a Plain Old Java Object (POJO).
choices.D: The REST resource implementation class must not be final.
choices.B: The REST resource class can be implemented as a stateful Enterprise JavaBean (EJB).

discussion.content: Here I would say that we should focus on asking about the implementation of the resource. Therefore I choose answer A.

C is the correct answer
According to https://docs.oracle.com/javaee/7/tutorial/jaxrs002.htm
A is correct (must extend the javax.ws.rs.core.Application) but so in C (can be implemented as a Plain Old Java Object (POJO))

comments.content: You can extend Application or use web.xml to map so option A (must) is not correct.

questions.question_text: How can you inject a target web service into an EJB?

choices.A: Define service as an injectable resource by using the <resource-ref> declaration.

choices.B: using the ManagedExecutors utility class to define the execution properties
choices.C: This cannot be done because this configuration is dependent on the Java EE Product Provider.
choices.D: configuring the thread pool info in the deployment descriptor

questions.question_text: How can you configure, in a portable way, the number of threads used by a ManagedExecutorService?

discussion.content:
not A. ManagedExecutorService doesnâ€™t have method for configure number of threads
it should be C or D
